abstract.text: Adds the given traits to the view.
A scrollable view.
Specifies whether to hide this view from system accessibility features.
Removes the given traits from this view.
Adds a modifier for this view that fires an action when a specific value changes.
Sets the color of the foreground elements displayed by this view.
Sets alternate input labels with which users identify a view.
Expands the safe area of a view.
Sets a limit for the number of lines text can occupy in this view.
The activation point for an element is the location assistive technologies use to initiate gestures.
Marks this view as searchable, which configures the display of a search field.
Ensures compatibility for
views across different OS versions.
Masks this view using the alpha channel of the given view.
Marks this view as searchable, which configures the display of a search field.
Layers the views that you specify behind this view.
Adds a modifier for this view that fires an action when a specific value changes.
Layers the views that you specify in front of this view.
Sets the sort priority order for this views accessibility element, relative to other elements at the same level.
Specifies if the view is focusable.
Adds a label to the view that describes its contents.

SwiftSafeUI-Icon.png.alt: A technology icon representing the SwiftSafeUI framework.

abstract.text: Encapsulates deprecation handling logic, ensuring compatibility across different OS versions.
Uses the string you specify to identify the view.
Adds a textual description of the value that the view contains.
Marks this view as searchable, which configures the display of a search field.
Sets the tint color within this view.
Communicates to the user what happens after performing the views action.
